moves.1. e4 e6 2. Nf3 d5 3. exd5 exd5 4. d4 Nf: Although h3 can be useful because it prevents the knight's pin, it also weakens future castling.
moves.5... c5: To create an unbalanced position with an isolated central pawn and good piece play.
moves.6. Bb5+ Nc6 7. Bxc6+: White has no compensation for Black's bishop pair and now the d5 pawn is no longer isolated.
moves.7... bxc6 8. Ne5 Qc7: It seemed like the most logical move, but you also have to consider Bd6 and Ba6
moves.9. O-O Bd6 10. Nf3 O-O 11. dxc5 Bxc5: From now on you have to pay attention to the move Bxh3 followed by Qg3 + by the pin of the f-pawn.
moves.12. Nd4: Avoid the tactical motif above, but this is the fourth time the knight has moved ...
moves.12... Re8 13. Be3 Bxh3: With this small combination based on the weakness of the castling (h3, g3) and the development advantage, the game is resolved.
